content.raw:
Universal joint in ODE is behaving correctly again after cc57302: bug fix, axis were flipped in `GetAngleImpl`.  This bug caused joint angles to be misread, causing bad interaction with the way implicit joint damping was implemented.  Filed issue #1107 for future improvements.

Additional improvement 7eaf3d9: extend universal joint angles reported / limits beyond +/-π
content.html:
Universal joint in ODE is behaving correctly again after cc57302: bug fix, axis were flipped in GetAngleImpl. This bug caused joint angles to be misread, causing bad interaction with the way implicit joint damping was implemented. Filed issue #1107 for future improvements.

Additional improvement 7eaf3d9: extend universal joint angles reported / limits beyond +/-π

content.raw:
ODE skips joint limits if they are larger then +/-π, see [this bit of code](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/6d9cc8763baf1697f4f93b27311fb722997ec10e/deps/opende/src/joints/universal.cpp?at=default#cl-270).

I am going to repeat the same [patch in hinge joint](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/6d9cc8763baf1697f4f93b27311fb722997ec10e/deps/opende/src/joints/hinge.cpp?at=default#cl-71) to extend angles beyond +/-π.
content.html:
ODE skips joint limits if they are larger then +/-π, see this bit of code.

I am going to repeat the same patch in hinge joint to extend angles beyond +/-π.

content.raw: Update: There is one failing test in `joint_universal.cc` for bullet. When the links are positioned at 90 degrees, the universal joint reports an angle that is equivalent to it's upper joint limit. Not sure yet what is going on.
content.html: Update: There is one failing test in joint_universal.cc for bullet. When the links are positioned at 90 degrees, the universal joint reports an angle that is equivalent to it's upper joint limit. Not sure yet what is going on.

update.title: Bullet universal joint

content.raw:
I may be going crazy, but I don't think ODE properly obeys universal joint limits. The `universal_joint_test.world` has a upper and lower limit of 1.4 radians on the first axis of `joint00`. In the integration test `joint_universal`, the link is moved such that the joint angle is 1.5707 radians. 

ODE happily reports the angle is 1.5707 radians. ODE will also allow you to control the joint well past it's set limits.

Bullet now behaves as I would expect. The joint constraint return 1.49 instead of 1.5707 (not perfect but closer to the 1.4 limit). Joint control also stops at 1.4.

This is just food for thought.
content.html:
I may be going crazy, but I don't think ODE properly obeys universal joint limits. The universal_joint_test.world has a upper and lower limit of 1.4 radians on the first axis of joint00. In the integration test joint_universal, the link is moved such that the joint angle is 1.5707 radians.

ODE happily reports the angle is 1.5707 radians. ODE will also allow you to control the joint well past it's set limits.

Bullet now behaves as I would expect. The joint constraint return 1.49 instead of 1.5707 (not perfect but closer to the 1.4 limit). Joint control also stops at 1.4.

This is just food for thought.
